title: Quick, Easy Guide on How to Open CR2 Files in Photoshop

steps.title: Try opening the CS2 file in Photoshop.
steps.content: Try opening the CS2 file in Photoshop. As long as you have a somewhat recent version of Photoshop, you can easily open CS2 files without installing anything extra. To open the file, just right-click (or Control + click ) the file on your PC or Mac, choose Open with , and then choose Adobe Photoshop .

steps.title: Install the latest Camera RAW plugin.
steps.content: Install the latest Camera RAW plugin. If you aren't able to open the file in Photoshop, you may need to install the Camera Raw plugin. Go to https://helpx.adobe.com/camera-raw/kb/camera-raw-plug-in-installer.html and click to download PC or Mac version as needed. If you can't use the most recent version of the plugin, try version 14.3 instead. If that doesn't work or if you have an older version of Photoshop, use version 10.5. Click the downloaded file, unzip it , then follow the on-screen instructions to install it .

steps.title: Update Creative Cloud apps (if your Photoshop is part of Creative Cloud).
steps.content: Update Creative Cloud apps (if your Photoshop is part of Creative Cloud). Although the apps update automatically, you might need to update Camera Raw manually. To do this, click the chain logo to open Creative Cloud, then click Apps > Updates > Check for Updates . Click Update next to "Photoshop". [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open your CR2 file in Photoshop.
steps.content: Open your CR2 file in Photoshop. You can either drag and drop the CR2 file on the Photoshop thumbnail or you can go to File > Open and select your camera file. [2] X Research source
